data.title: Paul McCartney announces cinema release of Wings documentary film
data.meta_description: Following the release of the live studio album 'One Hand Clapping', back in...
data.text:
One Hand Clapping

Following the release of the live studio album 'One Hand Clapping', back in June, Sir Paul McCartney has now announced the documentary film will be shown in cinemas next month.

The film of the same name as the album was recorded in 1974 as Sir Paul and his band Wings were recording their album, and follows the band behind the scenes as they work at Abbey Road Studios.

Taking to Instagram to share the exciting news, Sir Paul wrote: 'üé• One Hand Clapping üé•

'‚ÄúIt‚Äôs so great to look back on that period and see the little live show we did. We made a pretty good noise actually!‚Äù - Paul

'Abbey Road Studios, 1974. Get an intimate look behind the scenes when ‚ÄòPaul McCartney and Wings - One Hand Clapping‚Äô comes to the big screen for the first time, with limited screenings beginning 26th September. In addition to the full documentary directed by David Litchfield, the cinema event will feature the previously-unreleased ‚ÄòBackyard Sessions‚Äô, showcasing Paul on acoustic guitar in the garden behind Studio 2.

'Tickets go on sale 16th August. Sign-up for more information at www.OneHandClapping.Film (Link In Bio) #OneHandClappingFilm'.

What is the documentary film One Hand Clapping?

The synopsis for the film reads: 'Directed by David Litchfield, this film captured a moment when Paul McCartney and Wings had found and defined their signature sound. Filmed over four days at Abbey Road Studios in August 1974, the film provides an insight into the inner workings of the band as they work and play together in the studio.

'Including performances of tracks from Wings masterpiece Band on the Run (released in 1973), intimate footage of the band hanging out in the studio, combined with audio interview snippets, the film also includes previously unreleased in full footage of a solo acoustic performance by Paul called The Backyard Sessions.

'In addition to the film, this screening event includes an introduction by Paul McCartney recorded exclusively for movie theatre audiences as well as unseen Polaroids of the band.'

When do tickets go on sale for One Hand Clapping?

Ticket will go on sale on 16th August.

How to buy tickets for One Hand Clapping

You will be able to buy tickets from onehandclapping.film

When are the cinema showings of One Hand Clapping?

The showings will start on 26th September, the exact dates and locations have not yet been revealed.

How to listen to Absolute Radio:

Listen to Absolute Radio across the UK on your digital radio, the free Rayo app, by hitting that play button on the bottom of your screen or by asking your smart speaker to "play Absolute Radio".
